Class MessageEncoder

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.MessageEncoder
public final class MessageEncoder extends Object
Small helper for performing forward-only, single-pass message encoding with the standard Myra message header. The generator emits "builder" classes using this helper so callers never have to finalize header bookkeeping manually.

Thread Safety

This class is NOT thread-safe. Each thread should use its own MessageEncoder instance. The encoder maintains mutable state (writer position, header wrapper) that cannot be safely shared across threads.

However, the underlying MemorySegmentPool may be shared across threads if it is thread-safe (such as LockFreeBufferPool). In typical high-throughput scenarios:

  • Create one MessageEncoder per thread (or use thread-local)
  • Share a single MemorySegmentPool across all encoders

Example pattern: 

// Shared pool (thread-safe)
MemorySegmentPool pool = new LockFreeBufferPool(64 * 1024, 16);

// Per-thread encoder
ThreadLocal<MessageEncoder> encoderLocal = ThreadLocal.withInitial(
    () -> new MessageEncoder(pool));

// Usage in any thread
MessageEncoder encoder = encoderLocal.get();
MemorySegment segment = encoder.acquire(1024);
// ... encode message ...

    • MessageEncoder

      public MessageEncoder(express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.MemorySegmentPool pool)
      Creates a MessageEncoder with default configuration (checksum enabled).
      Parameters:
      pool - The memory segment pool for allocations.

    • MessageEncoder

      public MessageEncoder(express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.MemorySegmentPool pool, EncoderConfig config)
      Creates a MessageEncoder with the specified configuration.
      Parameters:
      pool - The memory segment pool for allocations.
      config - The encoder configuration controlling checksum behavior.

  • Method Details

    • acquire

      public MemorySegment acquire(int minCapacityBytes)
      Acquire a fresh MemorySegment from the configured pool. Callers must treat the returned segment as write-once. When finished, call finalizeMessage(MemorySegment, short, short) to finish the header and compute the checksum.

    • getWriter

      public express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.SegmentBinaryWriter getWriter(MemorySegment target)
      Provides the writer bound to the given target segment. This lets generated code append content at the correct offsets.

    • finalizeMessage

      public long finalizeMessage(MemorySegment target, short templateId, short schemaVersion)
      Finalize the encoded message: write header length, template id, schema version, flags and checksum (if enabled). This is a convenience helper used by generated builders to keep the encoding flow minimal.
      Parameters:
      target - The MemorySegment containing the encoded payload.
      templateId - The message template id.
      schemaVersion - The schema version to place into the header.
      Returns:
      The final frame length in bytes (including header).

    • config

      public EncoderConfig config()
      Returns the encoder configuration.
      Returns:
      The encoder configuration.

    • pool

      public express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.MemorySegmentPool pool()
      Access the underlying pool used for allocations. Generated builders can use this to create a `PooledSegment` to return ownership of the allocated segment back to callers.
